business.headline: Why is stock market falling today? 3 reasons you need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 443.21 points to 75,292.75 at 10:18 am and the NSE Nifty50 fell 143.75 points to trade at 22,769.40. Here are 3 things investors need to know about today's stock market downturn.

Sensex, Nifty fall as FII selling, Trump's tariff threat batter D-StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 272.61 points to 75,463.64 at around 9:51 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 91.80 points to 22,821.35.

PNB revises interest rates. Check new home, car and personal loan rates There will be zero processing fees and documentation charges on most of PNB's home loan schemes till March 31, 2025, thereby making housing loans more affordable and more accessible.
LIC Smart Pension Plan: Check eligibility and other details The Smart Pension Plan requires a minimum investment of Rs 1,00,000, while there is no cap on the maximum purchase limit.

Tesla set for India entry with first EV shipment in coming months: Report The US carmaker plans to start selling these cars in the three major cities of Mumbai, Delhi, and Bangalore around the third quarter of the year, say reports.

Sensex ends 200 points lower, Nifty below 23,000; HDFC falls over 2%Stock market closing today: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 203.22 points lower at 75,735.96, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 19.75 points to settle at 22,913.15.

Will Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs hurt Indian rupee? It may be noted that India was the 10th biggest exporter to the US in 2024, and higher tariffs might make it tougher for Indian businesses to sell their goods there.

Can employers deny gratuity in any situation? Here's all you need to knowWith the latest ruling, the Supreme Court has stated that if an employer dismisses an employee on grounds of moral turpitude, his gratuity can be forfeited without waiting for a court's verdict.

FIIs continue to dump Indian stocks: Which stocks are feeling the heat? Data from National Securities Depository Limited (NSDL) showed that FPIs have dumped $3.5 billion worth of financial stocks in 2025 so far, accounting for 31% of their total sales of $11.45 billion as of February 14.

RBI may allow some depositors of New India Co-op Bank to withdraw funds: Report Last week, the RBI took strict action against New India Co-operative bank by suspending deposit withdrawals for six months, stopping the issuance of new loans, and appointing an administrator.

Uday Kotak explains how FIIs are gaining at the expense of domestic investorsUday Kotak said that FIIs are benefiting from the investments made by domestic retail investors, who are continuously putting money into the stock market.

Google Pay begins charging for bill payments. Here's what users need to knowThis is not the first time Google Pay has announced the imposition of fees. Last year, it levied Rs 3 convenience fee for mobile recharges.

Indian exporters aren't losing sleep over Donald Trump's tariff threat. Here's whyIndustry executives say US tariff hikes on autos and pharmaceuticals won't hurt Indian exporters much, as competitors from other countries will face the same impact.

Will tax cuts for middle class in budget help boost consumption? RBI says this The RBI bulletin pointed out that the government has given a Rs 1 lakh crore tax break to the middle class, which should leave more money in their pockets.

Dalal Street carnage: Top market investors lose over Rs 80,000 croreThe recent stock market downturn has wiped out over Rs 80,000 crore from the portfolios of some of India's most renowned investors, such as Radhakishan Damani and the Jhunjhunwala family.

EPFO to roll out UPI-based EPF claim withdrawals within 3 months. Check detailsOnce integrated, claim amounts can be easily accessed by the subscribers via digital wallets, mention sources. This would minimise the processing time and lead to an enhanced user-friendly experience.

Is India's economy set for a strong recovery? Here's what RBI saysThe government's push on capital spending, MSMEs, agriculture, and exports is expected to help the economy in the long run while keeping the fiscal deficit in check. A recent repo rate cut might also support domestic demand.

Why shares of cigarette makers ITC, Godfrey Phillips are falling today?ITC's share price was trading 1.44% lower at Rs 400.65 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:06 am. Godfrey Phillips shares were down 4.58% to Rs 6,260 and VST Industries stock was down 3% to Rs 290.65.

Why NPS is better than EPF for tax saving under new tax regimeNPS vs EPF: In the case of EPF, employee contributions generally qualify for a deduction under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act, capped at Rs 1.5 lakh annually, under the Old Income Tax regime.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as FMCG, banking stocks drag marketThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 233.22 points to 75,705.96, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 75.05 points to 22,857.85 as of 9:38 AM.

Cigarette prices set to rise? Government may hike GST on tobacco productsCurrently, cigarettes and other tobacco products attract a GST of 28% along with various other levies, taking the total tax burden to 53%.

Dalal Street's losing streak: Why the market fall may not end soonStock Market: The earnings growth of Nifty50 companies was 5% in the October-December quarter, marking the third straight quarter of single-digit growth, which is a sharp contrast to the double-digit profit growth seen in the previous two years.
Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower in volatile session; small and midcaps gainThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 28.21 points lower at 75,939.18, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 12.40 points lower at 22,932.90.

FIIs continue to dump Indian stocks: What it means for your investment portfolioWith FIIs selling aggressively, smallcaps and midcaps bleeding, and China attracting inflows, here's what retail investors should do.

Tesla likely to set up shop in India, may invest $3-5 billion: Sources During their visit, Tesla executives are expected to hold meetings with officials from the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) and other key ministries.
Small SIP, big returns: Check how Rs 250 a month can grow to Rs 17 lakhSBI Mutual Fund's new JanNivesh SIP is making investing more accessible, letting anyone start with as little as Rs 250 a month.

Reliance is India's most valuable company. Check top 10 firms in Hurun India 500The 2024 Burgundy Private Hurun India 500 report values Reliance at Rs 17.5 lakh crore. TCS comes in second at Rs 16.1 lakh crore, and HDFC Bank takes third place with Rs 14.2 lakh crore.

Dr Reddy's, Aurobindo Pharma: Why pharma stocks fell in early trade today?The Nifty Pharma index dropped as much as 2% in early trade. Sun Pharma fell nearly 2%, Dr Reddy's dropped as much as 4%, and Aurobindo Pharma sank almost 6%. Cipla shares also fell.

Tata Motors shares get boost after CLSA upgrade. Check target priceTata Motors share price: At around 11:04 am, shares of Tata Motors were trading 0.34% higher at Rs 683.90 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). It was up over 1% in early trade.

Hexaware Technologies shares debut at 5% premium over IPO priceHexaware Technologies IPO listing: The listing was largely in line with expectations, as the grey market premium (GMP) had disappeared ahead of the debut, indicating weak demand.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT, pharma stocks drag marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex shed 291.20 points to 75,676.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 88.65 points to 22,856.65 as of 9:25 AM.

Quality Power IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing date Quality Power IPO allotment status: Investors who applied for the Quality Power IPO can check their allotment status through the BSE website or the registrar's website (Link Intime India Private Ltd).

Elon Musk's Tesla hunts for land in India, Maharashtra leads: ReportWhile Maharashtra is leading the race, other states are also vying for the project. Tesla's plans could change depending on the incentives offered by different states.

Unified Pension Scheme to roll out from April 1. Check eligibility and benefitsUnder the new pension scheme, government employees will contribute 10% of their basic salary along with DA, while the government's contribution will rise from the previous 14% to 18.5%.

ELSS explained: Check tax benefits under Section 80C and other key details ELSS offers market-linked returns and has the potential to generate higher long-term returns as compared to other Section 80C options, including PPF, ULIPS, and NPS, etc.

Trump's reciprocal tariffs could hurt Indian exports. Which sectors are at risk?While officials are still waiting for details on how these tariffs will be calculated, they are already preparing countermeasures and working on a trade deal proposal to reduce tariffs and boost two-way trade.

Sensex, Nifty bounce back from day's low to close flat; IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 29.47 points to close at 75,967.39, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 14.20 points to end at 22,945.30.

Want to save taxes? Try these 5 last-minute investment options to maximise benefitsThe Equity-Linked Savings Scheme (ELSS) is a popular tax-saving tool available under Section 80C, offering a lock-in period of three years. Under this, investments up to Rs 1.5 lakh are eligible for deductions.

Sugar gets costlier: Prices rise 6.5% in a month as output dipsSugar price hike: A drop in sugar output, caused by adverse weather and the reopening of sugar exports after two years, has led to a supply shortage, pushing up prices.

New Income Tax Bill: Will taxpayers with late ITR filings lose refunds?Late ITR filing refund concern: The Income Tax Act, 1961, does not prevent taxpayers from claiming a refund just because the return was filed after the deadline.

entertainment.headline: BB 18's Alice Kaushik, Tajinder Bagga, others reunite at Arfeen-Sara's Goa bashBigg Boss 18 contestants, including Alice Kaushik, Tajinder Bagga, and Nyrraa Banerjii reunited to celebrate Sara and Arfeen Khan's anniversary in Goa.

Dhanashree Verma's cryptic post amid divorce rumours: From stressed to blessedDhanashree Verma recently shared a cryptic message on social media, suggesting a shift from 'stressed to blessed'. This comes amid swirling rumours of a possible divorce with cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal.

TV actor Dipika Kakar Ibrahim quits Celebrity MasterChef amid health concernsPopular TV actor Dipika Kakar Ibrahim has withdrawn from Celebrity MasterChef due to health issues. Despite the show's support, she prioritised her well-being over the competition.

Rapper-singer Honey Singh arrives in Mumbai for sold-out concertHoney Singh is in Mumbai for the much-anticipated Stage AajTak Millionaire concert this Saturday, February 22. With a fantastic set list, the sold-out show promises a night full of magic and madness.

Jisoo, Seo In-guk to star in Netflix's next show on virtual datingJisoo and Seo In-guk are joining hands for an upcoming Netflix drama, Boyfriend on Demand. The show will explore virtual reality dating.
The Last Of Us Part 2 release date announced The Last Of Us Part 2's release date has been announced. The Pedro Pascal show is all set to stream on Prime Video from April 13.

Is Eminem finally coming to India? Rapper's leaked schedule hints soLeaked documents have suggested that Eminem will perform in Mumbai in June 2025 as part of his world tour. The rapper's first visit to India is stirring excitement among fans.
Iconic TV show CID now streaming on NetflixCID on Netflix: The iconic Indian crime series CID is now available on Netflix, allowing fans worldwide to stream the popular show.

Will Prime Video's Jack Reacher ever visit India? Author Lee Child speaksAuthor Lee Child, whose Reacher books have inspired a series on Prime Video, spoke to India Today Digital, about the possibility of seeing his leading character travelling to India in the future.

Vlogger Shenaz Treasury reveals losing a brand deal after Ranveer Allahbadia row Former actor and influencer Shenaz Treasury recently shared how she lost a brand deal after Ranveer Allahbadia's controversy.

Nadaaniyan: Ibrahim Ali Khan explains love to Miss Briganza; release date outNetflix on Thursday announced the release date of Ibrahim Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor's 'Nadaaniyan'. The film is a Gen-Z love story and is set in Delhi-Noida.

Palak Muchhal on timeless appeal of Sanam Teri Kasam title song: It's magicalSanam Teri Kasam's title track is topping the music charts. Singer Palak Muchhal calls it surreal, recalls recording it, and hints at a new version. She also discusses Amitabh Bachchan's praise and the evolving music industry.

general news.headline: Trump claims BRICS 'broke up' after tariff threat: Haven't heard from them latelyTrump claims BRICS, which includes India, 'broke up' after he threatened 150% tariffs for undermining dollar

No room for coercion: Jaishankar's veiled dig at China during G20 ministers' meetJaishankar said that the member nations must also recognise that multilateralism itself lies deeply damaged and that the UN and its Security Council are often grid-locked.

Watch: Trump aide's 'Malhari' edit to welcome new FBI chief Kash PatelTaking to X, Dan Scavino - who is US President Donald Trump's assistant and White House Deputy Chief of Staff - shared an edited 47-second dance clip from the film 'Bajirao Mastani' to congratulate Kash Patel on becoming the FBI director.
Woman showing impressive sword-wielding skills is NOT Delhi's new CM Rekha GuptaThe viral video shows actress Payal Jadhav showcasing her sword-wielding skills.

'For bureaucracy': Elon Musk waves chainsaw gifted by Argentina's MileiThe Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) headed by Tesla CEO and billionaire Elon Musk, claims to have saved $55 billion by February 19, with a single contract being worth USD 8 billion.

Elon Musk's spat with astronaut over Sunita Williams in space: Lie vs idiotFormer ISS commander Andreas Mogensen called out SpaceX CEO Elon Musk for claiming Joe Biden abandoned Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore in space for "political reasons". Musk was quick to counter, calling Mogensen an "idiot".

Youtuber Ashish Chanchlani seeks to cancel case in vulgar joke row, hearing todayYouTuber Ashish Chanchlani, who has been named in the FIR registered by Assam Police, has approached the Supreme Court seeking the cancellation of the case of transfer of the same to Mumbai, citing it was filed in the latter first.

Marriage falling apart not end of life, move ahead: Supreme Court to coupleThe Supreme Court, while dissolving the marriage of a couple, observed that a failed marriage is not the end of life and advised them to move forward peacefully.

It's 2025, but has dating become any easier for divorced Indian women?Everyone wants to find love—because why not? It's a magical feeling. But in this search for love, do divorced men have it easier than women?

LPU's 2025 Batch Final Year Student Bags Rs 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) Placement Package-Betireddy Naga Vamsi Reddy B. Tech student has secured a 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) package with an AI robotics company and is set to graduate in May 2025. 

-Over 1,700 students have received packages ranging from Rs 10 LPA – Rs 1 Crore per annum 

-1,912 students received multiple job offers while Adireddy Vasu, secured 7 job offers, setting a rare and impressive record.

RSS imprint, Modi's messaging: How Rekha Gupta got to the hot seat in DelhiGupta joins the BJP's small league of woman CMs, bringing to the table dyed-in-the-wool Sangh experience, strong organisational skills and an uncontroversial image

Salman Khan to play auto driver in Hollywood debut? Watch viral clipVideos of superstar Salman Khan filming his Hollywood debut in Dubai have gone viral on social media. In one clip, he is seen dressed as an auto driver, accompanied by actor and friend Sanjay Dutt.

Bhopal man, married 5 times, kills friend for opposing his marriage to sisterDuring interrogation, the accused admitted that he wanted to marry Sandeep's cousin Vandana, but Sandeep opposed the idea. To eliminate him, he conspired with his associates, Utkarsh Chaudhary and Adarsh Chaudhary.

Sourav Ganguly accident: Former India captain escapes unhurt after collision on roadFormer Indian captain Sourav Ganguly narrowly avoided a major accident en route to Burdwan University. Fortunately, no one was injured in the accident. However, two cars in Ganguly's convoy suffered minor damage.
Oppo Find N5 launched, company says it is the thinnest foldable phone in the worldOppo Find N5 has made a global debut of its world's thinnest foldable phone and it is priced around Rs 1,60,000.

Who is Veena Reddy, ex-USAID India chief facing BJP heatDonald Trump claimed that the previous Joe Biden administration in the US tried to interfere in India's elections by allocating a now-cancelled $21 million grant for voter turnout, implying it was intended to influence the outcome.

Please come back: KIIT founder apologises, asks Nepalese students to returnThe video of Samanta's first public statement on the incident was posted on KIIT's X platform, hours after he was summoned by the Odisha government's high-level committee probing the matter to appear before it on Friday.

USAID for voter turnout: Can Rs 182 crore turn an Indian election?US President Donald Trump suggested that USAID, an independent US aid agency that handles $42 billion of funds, interfered in India's electoral process. The USAID dedicated Rs 182 crore to boost voter turnout in India when the country spends Rs 16 lakh crore in general elections. Can this drop in the ocean influence poll outcomes?

Nilavuku Enmel Ennadi Kobam review: Dhanush's moon-aimed mission is half successfulReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025Nilavuku Enmel Ennadi Kobam movie review: Directed by Dhanush, the rom-com starring Pavish, Anikha Surendran and Matthew Thomas, is a fun film about love and friendships. The film has inconsistencies in screenplay, which never lets it rise.

Sonia Gandhi admitted to Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi: ReportWhile the exact time of admission is not immediately known, a source said, former Congress president Sonia Gandhi was admitted on Thursday morning.

Virat Kohli more worried about middling the ball instead of scoring: Robin UthappaFormer India batter Robin Uthappa commented on Virat Kohli's poor form after he got dismissed for 22 in India's first match of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 against Bangladesh.

Body released by Hamas not of mother of youngest hostages, Israel allegesIsrael's military accused Hamas of violating the ceasefire after failing to return Shiri Bibas's body, though her sons, Kfir and Ariel, were among the remains handed over.

Actor Veer Pahariya thanks trolls: My engagement soared, I'm getting more workActor Veer Pahariya embraces trolling over his viral Sky Force dance step, saying it boosted his career and got him wedding gigs. He thanks trolls, joking that he hopes for more so he can earn even more.

Salman Khan to play auto driver in Hollywood debut? Watch viral clipVideos of superstar Salman Khan filming his Hollywood debut in Dubai have gone viral on social media. In one clip, he is seen dressed as an auto driver, accompanied by actor and friend Sanjay Dutt.

sports.headline: 8 hours a day at NCA: Mohammed Shami's relentless grind for Champions Trophy gloryMohammed Shami stamped his authority with the ball in India's Champions Trophy opener against Bangladesh. Shami picked up 5 wickets and overtook Zaheer Khan as India's most successful bowler in the ICC white-ball tournaments.

Champions Trophy: Pakistan fined for slow-over rate against New ZealandPakistan were fined 5 percent of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate against New Zealand in their Champions Trophy opener, adding to their struggles as they prepare for a high-stakes clash against India on February 22.

Champions Tropphy: Hridoy hopeful century vs India will build confidenceBangladesh batter Towhid Hridoy expressed optimism after his maiden ODI century against India in the Champions Trophy opener on February 20, believing the knock will boost his confidence and play a crucial role in shaping his international cricketing career.

Shami dedicates bowling brilliance vs Bangladesh to 'role model' fatherIndia's veteran pacer Mohammed Shami dedicated his stunning five-wicket haul against Bangladesh in the Champions Trophy opener to his father, whom he hailed as his greatest inspiration and role model, crediting him for shaping his cricketing journey and resilience.

Sourav Ganguly accident: Former India captain escapes unhurt after collision on roadFormer Indian captain Sourav Ganguly narrowly avoided a major accident en route to Burdwan University. Fortunately, no one was injured in the accident. However, two cars in Ganguly's convoy suffered minor damage.

5-star Shami not stressing over India vs Pakistan: No special mindsetMohammed Shami remains unfazed ahead of India's high-stakes Champions Trophy clash against Pakistan, trusting his momentum from a stellar five-wicket haul against Bangladesh instead of adopting a special mindset for the blockbuster encounter.

Virat Kohli more worried about middling the ball instead of scoring: Robin UthappaFormer India batter Robin Uthappa commented on Virat Kohli's poor form after he got dismissed for 22 in India's first match of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 against Bangladesh.

Harbhajan Singh wants India to learn 'one lesson' despite win against Bangladesh  Champions Trophy: Former Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh said that India should try and put around 280-300 runs on the board while batting first to put pressure on the opposition on the slow and low pitches at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Who said what after Shami, Shubman Gill help India beat Bangladesh Champions Trophy: Rohit Sharma praised Shubman Gill and Mohammed Shami for their incredible performance after India beat Bangladesh by six wickets. Shanto, on the other hand, said that losing wickets in the powerplay pushed the Tigers back on the backfoot.

Shami reveals reason behind 'flying kiss' after 5-wicket haul vs BangladeshChampions Trophy 2025: Fast bowler Mohammed Shami said that he did the flying kiss celebration for his father after taking the five-wicket haul against Bangladesh on Thursday in Dubai.

Shubman Gill repays Rohit Sharma's faith, hits another ton as vice captainStar India batter Shubman Gill scored a magnificent hundred to script a six-wicket win for India in their first game of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 in Dubai.

Shubman Gill repays Rohit Sharma's faith, hits another ton as vice captainStar India batter Shubman Gill scored a magnificent hundred to script a six-wicket win for India in their first game of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 in Dubai.

Rohit Sharma plans to take Axar Patel out for 'dinner' after drop catch on hat-trickChampions Trophy: Rohit Sharma said that he plans to take Axar Patel out for dinner after dropping a catch off his bowling during India's match against Bangladesh at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Gritty Gill, sensational Shami help India overcome tricky Bangladesh test in DubaiIndia begin their Champions Trophy 2025 campaign with a win over tricky Bangladesh. Shubman Gill's gritty century and Mohammed Shami's terrific 5-wicket haul were the highlight of India's win on Thursday.

Axar Patel recalls emotions prior to Rohit's catch drop: Almost began celebratingIndia all-rounder Axar Patel opened up on the roller coaster of emotions which went inside his head just before Rohit Sharma dropped Bangladesh's Jaker Ali's catch which denied him a hat-trick during the Champions Trophy 2025 match.

Afghanistan aim to repeat past heroics against South Africa on debut Champions Trophy: Afghanistan are looking to make their debut a memorable one when they face South Africa on February 21 at the National Stadium in Karachi. The Afghans have won three bilateral ODI series on the trot.

AFG vs SA, all you need to know: Karachi pitch report, playing XIChampions Trophy: Afghanistan and South Africa begin their campaign in Karachi on Friday, February 21. Both teams have done well in the ICC tournaments in recent past and will look to continue their charge.

MS Dhoni addresses retirement rumours, gives life lessons in heartfelt speechLegendary MS Dhoni has addressed the topic of his retirement once again. The former CSK captain, who stepped away from international cricket after the ODI World Cup 2019 said that he wants to enjoy his cricket.

Not here just to participate, our aim is to win the final: Hashmatullah ShahidiAfghanistan Captain Hashmatullah Shahidi has made it clear to the rest of the teams in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 that they're not here just to participate and will give their all to win the trophy. Afghanistan start their campaign on February 21 vs South Africa.

Rohit Sharma faster than Sachin Tendulkar to 11,000 ODI runs, trails Virat KohliChampions Trophy 2025: Rohit Sharma reached the landmark of 11K runs in ODIs during India's match against Najmul Hossain Shanto's Bangladesh on Thursday, February 20 at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Afghanistan start their campaign on February 21 vs South Africa.

Hashmatullah Shahidi sends warning to South Africa: We beat them 2-1 in SharjahAfghanistan captain Hashmatullah Shahidi has sent a warning to South Africa ahead of their first game in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on February 21.

Badminton star Satwiksairaj Rankireddy's father, 65, dies due to cardiac arrestIndia badminton star Satwiksairaj Rankireddy's father R Kasi Viswanatham died due to cardiac arrest. Satwik's father was set to meet his son in New Delhi.

Mohammed Shami sets world record, faster than Mitchell Starc to 200 ODI wickets Champions Trophy 2025: Mohammed Shami picked up his 200th wicket in India's Group A match against Bangladesh in Dubai. The senior pacer returned to fine form, leading India's bowling attack in the marquee tournament.

Champions Trophy: Shoaib Akhtar fumes at Pakistan for timid batting vs New Zealand Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has slammed the national side for their timid batting approach in their opening match of the ICC Champions Trophy vs New Zealand.

Watch: Wasim Akram's hilarious take on Babar Azam's slow knock vs New ZealandChampions Trophy 2025: Wasim Akram came up with a hilarious analogy to describe Babar Azam's 90-ball 64, which cost Pakistan their opening match against New Zealand in Karachi.

Babar Azam's poor intent at start cost Pakistan vs New Zealand: Sanjay BangarFormer India cricketer and batting coach Sanjay Bangar said that Babar Azam's poor intent with the bat cost Pakistan dearly in their opening match of the Champions Trophy vs New Zealand.

Is ODI cricket dying? Fans question empty stands in India vs Bangladesh gameThe empty stands at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium during the India vs Bangladesh match of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 went viral all over social media as fans began questioning the relevance of ODI cricket.

Rohit Sharma drops catch to deny Axar hat-trick, slams ground in frustrationIndia vs Bangladesh: India captain Rohit Sharma dropped the simplest of catches in the slip on Thursday, February 20. Rohit's drop in 1st slip denied Axar Patel of what could have been his maiden hat trick.

Yuzvendra Chahal shares another cryptic post, thanks God amid divorce rumoursIndia cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal shared yet another cryptic post on Instagram amid divorce rumours with partner Dhanashree Verma. Chahal took to Instagram to thank God for protecting him from evil.

Favouritism at its peak: Fans fume as India drop Arshdeep, pick Harshit RanaIndia vs Bangladesh, Champions Trophy 2025: India dropped Arshdeep Singh and picked Harshit Rana in their XI for their first match in Dubai on Thursday. Mohammed Shami returned to the XI along with Ravindra Jadeja.

WTA bans 'fixated' fan after Emma Raducanu incident in Dubai incidentThe WTA has banned a man for "fixated behavior" toward Emma Raducanu after security removed him during her Dubai Championship match, leaving the former U.S. Open champion visibly shaken but determined to compete.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.
